message: No demo for my app. We're still figuring out how to lay it out, which isn't as bad as it sounds :-)
we were still putting our demo together.  it wasn't in time, so essentially no.
i'm pretty sure our demo wasn't working when they checked, but we're just getting started
I did a screencast, since i didnt have enough to put it on a server
ok ... we too have a demo , though not a web based so couldnt show it . Hopefully will present  it in the interview if we get a chance.
We have a demo, but applications were shut off before we got chance to include the url so effectively we applied without
we got a rough demo together and did a video to show it off, since the demo UX sucks right now.
Ours is just so shiny and beautiful, I really hope we get a chance to demo. We're adding another feature right now, thats why my posts are so sporadic
@flipside you're in good company - our designer had some kind of "family emergency" and never delivered anything...  So our site is pretty much empty
looks like there are some if not many that applied without a demo ...
@bobo_doumba can it be viewed w/ video?
we also thought we could finish our demo after we turned in our app, we were naive, things went wrong =P
@webwright I think people set too high a bar for an acceptable demo.
@webwright I actually worry that our demo doesn't give a good sense of the intention of the product.
One thing that became clear in the process of applying is that the application, just like the product, would never be "done".  just prioritize and get it as good as possible.
@webwright yeah we are awesome :P ... in fact we are planning to tattoo "awesome" on our arm ;)
We started coding March 2 so it was a mad rush to get a demo up. Now the site is 10x better than it was. Fingers crossed it was good enough on March 20.
nevertheless, at this point i'm not stressed anymore by the outcome, i guess pg and associates already made their choices :-)
in the future, probably would be good to clarify what the expectations are for a demo

the high bar was def a reason ... we have our functional app ready ( for desktops ) but since we were pithing for a web based app for mobiles we didnt include the screenshots ... moreover our solution at present more focussed on our algo so not much there in the app
hope its not a make or break issue

As someone who helped review the apps, I was STUNNED how few people had some sort of demo.  If you're a month away, why didn't you just start a month earlier?  If it was a last minute idea, why wouldn't you take a weekend and get some good wireframes together?
we chose to focus on the application since they said they won't even check out the demo unless everything else checks out
I think YC has a pretty good imagination of how things could evolve to something awesome.
Woot! Thx.  I stepped down 7 months ago-- It's weird to not be there, but it's still kicking ass and growing.
but we did have one ;-)
@webwright thanks for rescuetime, btw
i don't currently use it, but it helped me break some bad habits.

Every app is probably different.  A demo or screenshot (for a consumer app) can make it clear that you can make non-confusing/non-ugly/functional stuff (or at least be on the road to it).  It's all a balancing act-- the more awesome your team, the less critical your demo/traction probably is.
there was no any code, when we applied and those nothing to showcase. Now i understand, we should've just sen't some copy of our work papers :-)
@jdunck This is our case. However the main reason is that the core of our project can't be viewed like a website.
@jdunck i meant weant we've worked so fare on the mathematics behing our algorithms.

@webwright I should have clarified, we started the current version a month before the deadline. The original version was started in Feb as proof of concept, shown to friends, and with the feedback we started on the demo version March 2.
@webwright now you're making me nervous, we were aiming to demo the product and not a mockup. things didn't work out as planned unfortunately.
Yaw, there are probably other ways to convey "We've already built lots of awesome stuff" other than a demo (screencast, etc).
@flipside That makes sense.  Given the volume of apps, I imagine many of the demos don't get looked at.
Tattoos definitely help.
I think ours didn't. :-/

i think stamping it on some cool t-shirt is a better idea,
i won't be surprised if tomorrow won't bring another word: like "stunning". ;-)
@webwright at the time of applying, we had some pretty sweet mockups: http://foysavas.posterous.com/48810400. would it have been appropriate to have included them?
My demo/site was up and running, though I had a headache with our server a few days before submissions... I'm not sure if they looked at it though.
lol
it's not a demo more of the lamo
